thread.title: Tom Brady (and Gisele) was fired up after the Patriots’ first touchdown against the Cowboys - Patriots
thread.title_full: Tom Brady (and Gisele) was fired up after the Patriots’ first touchdown against the Cowboys - Patriots

author: Chris Greenberg
title: Tom Brady (and Gisele) was fired up after the Patriots’ first touchdown against the Cowboys - Patriots
text:
Tom Brady was fired up. Gisele was too.
After scoring the Patriots’ first touchdown against the Cowboys on a one-yard rush during the second quarter on Sunday, Brady celebrated by emphatically spiking the football.
 Watch for the Tom Brady QB-keeper TD Stay for the #BradySpike and LET'S GO reaction. #NEvsDAL http://t.co/Tqm20CMmqT
— NFL (@NFL) October 11, 2015 Gronk should aprove.
The touchdown and ensuing extra-point conversion staked the Patriots to a 10-3 lead. Brady could be seen exhorting his teammates after returning to the visitors sideline at AT&T Stadium.
"LET'S GO!" "LET'S GOOOO!" Oh yeah. TB12 is FIRED UP! #NEvsDAL http://t.co/7eqnUYib60
— NFL (@NFL) October 11, 2015 While Brady was passionately encouraging the Patriots, his wife, supermodel Gisele Bundchen, was rallying followers on Twitter.
Go papai #Touchdown ???
— Gisele B�ndchen (@giseleofficial) October 11, 2015 The touchdown may have had added meaning for both after Cowboys defensive end Greg Hardy made inflammatory comments about Gisele leading up to the game. Of course, Brady could have just been extremely excited about recording his first rushing touchdown since 2012 despite facing a Cowboys pass rush that had already sacked him four times to that point.
TOUCHDOWN! Brady with 1-yd QB keeper to give #Patriots 10-3 lead. That's Brady's first rushing TD since 2012 season #NEvsDAL
— New England Patriots (@Patriots) October 11, 2015 PHOTOS: Cowboys vs. Patriots
